Event.name: Intentional_deception
Event.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Deceiver</fen> performs some action so that the <fen>Victim</fen> ends up with an incorrect understanding about some <fen>Topic</fen>. The <fen>Means</fen> may be via communication, perceptual obscuration, or merely performing an action that the <fen>Victim</fen> will draw incorrect conclusions from.
<ex><fex name="Deceiver">The government</fex> <t>deceived</t> <fex name="Victim">the public</fex> <fex name="Time">last year</fex> <fex name="Topic">about the existence of evidence in several corruption trials</fex>.</ex>
<ex>I can't believe <fex name="Deceiver">they</fex> <t>fooled</t> <fex name="Victim">me</fex> <fex name="Means">with that old trick</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Deceiver
Arg.definition: <def-root>The person who acts so as to give the <fen>Victim</fen> an incorrect idea about a <fen>Topic</fen>. <ex><fex name="Deceiver">Politicians</fex> do nothing but <t>deceive</t> us about money.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Victim
Arg.definition: <def-root>The person who receives an incorrect idea because of the <fen>Deceiver</fen>'s actions. <ex>Practicing deception upon them , </ex> <ex>Sometimes it may be the case that the press itself stands as a monolith <m>practicing</m> <t>deception</t> <fex name="Victim">upon the people</fex> .</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Topic
Arg.definition: <def-root>The entity to which the misleading idea relates, what it is about. <ex>You <t>deceived</t> me <fex name="Topic">about the location of the diamonds</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The action performed by the <fen>Deceiver</fen> to fool the <fen>Victim</fen>.
<ex>Chris <t>misled</t> me <fex name="mea">with her powers of persuasion</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The time at which the deception occurs.
<ex>Some, looking for decent employment, said they were <t>deceived</t> <fex name="tim">soon after getting off the train</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The location at which the deception occurs.
<ex>It's hard to <t>fool</t> someone <fex name="pla">in their own home</fex>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: fool.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to deceive, often so that the victim seems ridiculous

lexUnit.name: mislead.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to deceive, to lead to an incorrect conclusion or judgment.

lexUnit.name: deceive.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to cause to come to an incorrect judgment or conclusion.

lexUnit.name: deception.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an act of deceiving someone.

lexUnit.name: get.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: To succeed in deceiving. Normally used humorously. Normally occurs in past-tense and involves speech participants, e.g. "You got me" or "I totally got you".
